title.narrative: IR 3.4: JUSTICE FOR CHILDREN SYSTEMS

description.narrative: Justice for children systems increasingly adopt family and community care alternatives for children in contact with the law, which contributes to Access To Justice, Justice For Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Quality and coverage of child protection services and programmes to prevent violence against children are strengthened and supported by national policies and budgets

mailing-address.narrative: 87 Misr Helwan Agricultural Road Maadi Cairo

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Justice for children systems increasingly adopt family and community care alternatives for children in contact with the law

description.narrative: Children in contact with the law benefited from increased access to legal aid (997 children) and an increase in access to non custodial sentences (20% of the cases). The final draft for the national guidelines of child victims, witnesses, and restorative justice was launched and endorsed by Government partners. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: % of children in conflict with law for minor crimes and administrative cases, who are referred to community and family care alternatives to detention (among those receiving legal aid from ECO partners)- in intervention areas -Cairo and Alex

actual.value: 2016:Regarding percentage of non-custodial sentences, it is 10%. Out of the 314, we have 31 non-custodial sentences.
